commit 73ff950cbb2df9382ce7d8ee3f2f0e522298f11b
Author: Lionel Sausin <clonedagain@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2017-09-19 08:27:24 +0200

    Add instructions to use --install-scripts in pip (#1890)
    
    At least on Ubuntu Precise and Xenial, ``pip install shinken`` does not install the executables in the search path.
    We have to add ``--install-option="--install-scripts=/usr/local/bin"`` to make it install to the expected directory.

2	0	doc/source/02_gettingstarted/installations/shinken-installation.rst

commit a82e11a1836633be51cb6fbe4997db62c4c435ec
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-09-19 08:27:00 +0200

    Enh: extend duplicate_foreach to host/hostgroups (#1905)
    
    This patch moves the phase where `duplicate_foreach` services are
    expanded in order to open the use of `duplicate_foreach` clause to hosts and
    hostgroups bound services, not only to service templates.
    
    The parameter can be configured on services directly attached to hosts
    and hostgroups:
    
        define service {
            use                    generic-service
            service_description    Disk %KEY%
            command                check_disk!$KEY$
            duplicate_foreach      _disks
            host_name              test_host_1
            hostgroups             test_hostgroup_1
        }

Merge: 387632a30 eb9c592d2
Author: Olivier H <olivier.hanesse@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-06-28 17:19:30 +0200

    Merge pull request #1919 from geektophe/fix_http_client_uncaught_exc
    
    Fix: http_client exceptions management

commit eb9c592d290bd3315cc27987ac7931744645db5d
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-06-28 13:29:22 +0200

    Fix: http_client exceptions management
    
    This patch fixes a bug in `http_client`: when an HTTP code != 200 is got,
    an uncaught exception is risen, which results in a service crash.
    
    The `Exception` instance is replaced by an `HTTPException`, which is
    correctly handled. The `put()` method error management behavior has also
    been harmonized with other methods.

6	6	shinken/http_client.py

Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-06-23 09:18:50 +0200

    Fixed OSX (darwin) platform detection
    
    In setup.py, the instruction `'win' in sys.platform` breaks system detection
    on OSX computers (`sys.platform == "darwin"`).
    
    This patch hardens windows platform detection.

Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-06-22 11:28:08 +0200

    Fixed unicode string parisng in shinken cmdline
    
    The `cprint` function in the `termcolor` library in the shinken cli does not
    correctly handle unicode strings, and raises an UnicodeEncodeError.
    
    This patch checks and encodes unicode strings to prevent this bug.

2	0	shinken/misc/termcolor.py

commit 02e1a95e66fef0940d1e358d57f6a53b0a0ac48a
Merge: d58119479 3f01a0a57
Author: Olivier H <olivier.hanesse@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-06-12 10:48:58 +0200

    Merge pull request #1914 from geektophe/enh_mem_free_opt_in
    
    Enh: Made memory free an opt-in option

commit 3f01a0a57c4fa99fc73b02c9d100b55b6e8351fb
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-06-11 08:34:12 +0200

    Made memory free an opt-in option
    
    As I'm not totally sure that freeing memory using low level libc6 calls
    will work on all distributions, I prefer to let the user decide whether or
    not to use it.
    
    The call to `memory_free()` is now disabled by default, and may be
    activated by setting the `aggressive_memory_management` option to `1` in
    the daemons ini configuration file.
    
    For instance, in `schedulerd.ini`:
    
        ...
        port=7768
        daemon_enabled=1
        aggressive_memory_management=1
        ...

commit 563874df3a40e8a55471bdd9be75f58ead128ddb
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-05-05 23:30:48 +0200

    More reliable graceful restart
    
    This patch enhances graceful restart by checking that the child process
    starts correctly. If not so, it continues reloads configuration without
    forking a new child.
    
    It also ensures the multiprocessing manager really stops.

Merge: 9df258667 3550e2c9a

commit 3550e2c9ae56ad5475fc02f873ffe619ddfa2182
Author: Nicolas Le Manchet <nicolas.le-manchet@ovh.net>
Date:   2016-05-05 10:17:34 +0200

    Improve systemd units reliability
    
    * KillMode and TimeoutStopExec: instead of just stopping or killing the
    master process, try to stop the master process, then if it
    does not stop all the sub processes, kill all the sub processes one by
    one. Sub processes are tracked via cgroups.
    * PIDFile: do not make systemd guess which process is the master, but
    instead let Shinken tell which one it the master.
    * Restart and RestartSec: if Shinken exits for a strange reason
    (SIGKILL, exit with wrong exit code...) wait 30 sec and restart it.

5	2	for_fedora/systemd/shinken-arbiter.service
4	1	for_fedora/systemd/shinken-broker.service
5	2	for_fedora/systemd/shinken-poller.service

5	2	for_fedora/systemd/shinken-receiver.service

commit 5347de922623611f140d0797490f59901d02ead2
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-02-03 22:05:28 +0100

    Memory leak hunding
    
    This patch introduces several features to protect services from  memory leaks
    in big environmensts, including queues throttling options, memory watchdog and
    graceful restart.
    
    **Queues throttling**
    
    In big environments where pollers or reactionners manage many concurrent
    actions, a synchronization effect may appear where a single poller or scheduler
    gets all the scheduled actions at once. The result is a single machine drawing
    almost all the workload, the other doing almost nothing.
    
    This may lead to a chain reaction described below (let's illustrate it with a
    poller, it's the same for reactionners).
    
    - A poller gets more actions it can manage.
    - Under high load, the concurrency creates a contention on the internal queues.
    - When contention lowers (because actions get executed), big results
      lists are returned to the scheduler.
    - The scheduler has to deserialize many objects at once to integrate them.
      As the python interpreter does not correctly free the used memory, this
      may generate a memory leak: object are deserialized into memory, processed,
      then deleted, but the used memory is not really freed by the interpreter.
    - Each integrated result generates a new brok, which creates huge broks
      lists.
    - The broker fetching all the broks at once, it has to deserialize huge broks
      lists, involving the same effect as on the scheduler.
    
    The higher the load, the worst the effect.
    
    In addition, if results are too long to come back, the actions get rescheduled
    which aggravate the phenomenon.
    
    This may lead to machines crash due to memory exhaustion.
    
    To prevent this situation, throttling options have been added to control
    the number of checks a poller or reactionner may get, the number of
    results it may return, and the number of broks a broker may get. They
    are described below.
    
    *Poller and reactionner options*
    
    - `max_q_size`: defines the maximum number of actions (slots) a poller (or
      reactionner) may hold.
    - `q_factor`: same option as the previous one, but the number of
      available slots is calculated from the formula `workers *
      processes_by_worker * q_factor`, so it may automatically adapt to the
      number of CPU cores.
    - `results_batch`: defines the maximum number of results a poller or
      reactionner may return at once.
    
    *Broker options*
    
    - `broks_batch`: defines the maximum number of broks a broker may get at once.
    
    **Graceful restart**
    
    Another memory leak comes when new configuration is sent from the arbiter.
    As the configuration is made of many objects linked by circular references,
    they are not properly garbage collected. To release this memory, the only
    solution is to restart the service.
    
    This patch introduces the graceful restart. If enabled, when a new
    configuration is received by a daemon, it forks a new daemon and send it the
    received configuration on stdin. Next it exits to let the newly spawned
    instance replace it. This avoids having to wait for a new configuration
    after a classical restart.
    
    Graceful restart can be enabled by setting the `graceful_enabled` to `1` in
    the daemon configuration.
    
    **Memory watchdog**
    
    To protect the machines from crashing because of memory exhaustion if the
    previous options are not or badly set, a memory watchdog may be activated with
    the `harakiri_threshold` in the services configuration. It automatically
    restarts the services if their memory goes above the threshold.
    
    **Actions priority**
    
    The patch also introduces the checks, event handlers and notifications priority.
    The commands may be added the `priority` attribute. When daemons ask the
    scheduler for actions, it will send the actions with the lowest `priority`
    first. This allows to guaranties that important actions will get executed
    first.
    
    **Note**: by default, the options above are not set, and the services
    operate as usual.
    
    **Note2**: this patch allows to manage slightly bigger configuration on
    a single scheduler. It is no more necessary to spawn many scheduler to
    spread the objects.

commit c299285c3be3473eb0c53286102c827ea39288eb
Author: Quest <quest@windwards.net>
Date:   2015-12-26 22:14:15 +0100

    Reverse dependency admin <-> admins.
    
    When admins declared admin as a member, any standardised packaging
    (e.g. Docker) would have to include a user admin as declared by
    contacts/admin.cfg. With users declaring their groups, admin.cfg can
    simply be excluded in packaging.

commit e3b782e9667c9fbd7588955a7aadc399805c98d6
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-12-09 12:10:57 +0100

    Minor fixes, statsd metrics and doc addition
    
    - Normalized metric base names: added emitter service, added metric
      namespace under the form: {namespace}.{service}.{metric}[.{direction}]
    - Added metric name pattern to contol the way metric are named in satsd
    - Added metric type filter to control which metric is sent to statsd
    - Timeout and wait-ratio metrics moved to gauges
    - Added statsd metrics documentation
    - Added satellite queues metrics

commit 27fbb5bbdd9d1417507c1dafd4a6a380fe203dc4
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-10-20 20:56:12 +0200

    Refactored stats methods, added memory stats
    
    The incr method was used in several places to measure timings. This
    patch renamed this method into timing.
    
    Also normalized the base metrics to send to statsd and
    kernel.shinken.io, and added memory, internal queues length (broks,
    actions, checks, ...), managed objects (hosts and services) where
    relevant.
    
    This additional data is collected and sent by an additional
    thread.

Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-10-15 14:00:05 +0200

    Push some more internal metrics into statsd
    
    This patch adds (and extends) metrics sent to kernel.shinken.io into statsd,
    such as number of elements in the  queues, number of managed objects, and so
    on.
    
    Those metrics are collected and sent to statsd by a dedicated thread, with
    frequency controlled by the new `statsd_interval` in the global configuration
    file (which defaults to 5s).

commit d98ba1aa352de770b747f33f3aaef8fed55bfa24
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-30 00:23:25 +0200

    Enh: allow white space between foreach elements
    
    This patch allows to separate the elements from a `duplicate_foreach`
    statement entry with white spaces for better readability.
    
    Example:
    
    The statement:
    
        C$(80%!90%)$,D$(95%!70%)$,E,F$(95%!70%)$,G
    
    May also be written:
    
       C $(80%!90%)$, D $(95%!70%)$, E, F $(95%!70%)$,G

3	3	shinken/util.py
1	1	test/etc/service_generators/hosts.cfg

commit 1bf2f629716b7032816d27afb1dfd57f2e362ed5
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-29 22:53:30 +0200

    Enh: implemented initial_state management
    
    This patch adds management of the `initial_state` attribute on hosts and
    services.
    
    This attribute was available as an host or service attribute, but no
    code behind took it into account.
    
    An host or service initial state default value is still `PENDING`, but
    it may be overridden for a specific host or service by setting its
    `initial_state`. The initial output may also be configured via the
    `initial_output` attribute.
    
    Examples:
    
    define host{
        use                          generic-host
        host_name                    test_host_0
        address                      127.0.0.1
        initial_state                u
        initial_output               Waiting for status
    }
    
    define service {
      use                            generic-service
      host_name                      test_host_0
      service_description            test_service_0
      initial_state                  o
      initial_output                 Waiting for status
    }
    
    **Caution**: the initial state of hosts or services are configured at
    configuration parse level, but they may be overwritten by the scheduler
    when the retention data is loaded if a previous state has been saved.

commit 72efca3442f00b929f8e78b1caa773aa655e66a0
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-28 21:47:03 +0200

    Fix: fixed svc template level defined description
    
    This patch fixes a series of regressions that prevented to define services
    which `services_description` attribute is inherited from an upper level
    template.
    
        define hostgroup {
            hostgroup_name  cisco-routers
            alias           Cisco Routers
        }
    
        define host{
            use         router-host
            host_name   r1
            address     1.1.1.1
            hostgroups  +cisco-routers
        }
    
        define host{
            use         router-host
            host_name   r2
            address     1.1.1.2
            hostgroups  +cisco-routers
        }
    
        define service{
            name                    ssh-critical-service
            use                     generic-service
            service_description     SSH
            register                0
        }
    
        define service {
                use             ssh-critical-service
                hostgroup_name  cisco-routers
        }
    
    This example initially raised an error because services generated from
    hostgroup `cisco-routers` did not define the `service_description` attribute
    (this syntax is obviously correct, it should have been inherited from
    `ssh-critical-service`) and item pre-add checks were too restrictive.
    
    The first fix tried to introduce the partial service notion for services
    not defining their `service_description`, but saving the service in an
    alternate dictionnary broke the hostgroup explosion in the same
    situation: the object holding the hostgroup was saved in the
    `partial_services` dictionary then reintroduced in the `items`
    dictionnary whereas it should have been trashed.
    
    The patch removed the *partial services* related code and reworked the
    restrictions in `Service.add_item()` method controlling objets add and
    indexing.

commit 401f98320322ff37a2bc9fc16a293037e1f95169
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-27 23:51:36 +0200

    Fix: duplicate service from tmp with same name
    
    This patch fixes a regression appearing when services are generated with
    a `duplicate_foreach` statement from a common host template, and where
    description differs only by the expanded value of $KEY$ macro.
    
    In such a situation, only the lastly defined host would have its
    services generated.
    
    Example:
    
        define host{
          ...
          host_name                      test_host
          use                            generic-host
          register                       0
        }
    
        define host{
          use                            test_host
          host_name                      test_host_1
          _sdescr1                       svc1, svc2
        }
    
        define host{
          use                            test_host
          host_name                      test_host_2
          _sdescr2                       svc3, svc4
        }
    
        define service{
          ...
          host_name                      test_host
          service_description            $KEY$
          servicegroups                  servicegroup_01,ok
          use                            generic-service
          check_command                  command1
          duplicate_foreach          _sdescr1
          register                       0
        }
    
        define service{
          ...
          host_name                      test_host
          service_description            $KEY$
          servicegroups                  servicegroup_01,ok
          use                            generic-service
          duplicate_foreach          _sdescr2
          check_command                  command2
          register                       0
        }
    
    In the previous example, only half the services would have been generated.

15	5	shinken/objects/service.py
21	0	test/etc/service_generators/hosts.cfg

commit 4fec65995838367ad3134e62c9ebd02779ad750b
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-27 12:54:09 +0200

    Service excludes/includes/overrides extension
    
    This patch extends the service excludes/includes/overrides feature by
    allowing to select target services in `service_excludes`,
    `service_excludes` and `service_overrides` host attribute
    using `*` (meaning all services attached to the host), or using a regular
    expression (using the `r:` prefix) on the host's services
    `service_description` attribute.
    
    Examples:
    
        define host {
            ...
            host_name test
            service_excludes *
            ....
        }
    
    This example would exclude all services from host `test`.
    
        define host {
            ...
            host_name test
            service_excludes r:^proc
            ....
        }
    
    This example would exclude all services from host `test` which
    `service_description` starts by `proc`.
    
        define host {
            ...
            host_name test
            service_overrides *,notification_period workhours
            ....
        }
    
    This example would enforce `notification_period` to `workhours` on all
    services from host `test`.
    
        define host {
            ...
            host_name test
            service_overrides r:^proc,notification_period workhours
            ....
        }
    
    This example would enforce `notification_period` to `workhours` on all
    services from host `test` which `service_description` starts by `proc`..
    
    **Caution**: regular expressions are case sensitive, and a regular
    expression which is matched by none of the services on the host would
    still raise an error.

commit 6fe9991ca0bd07becdb96dec3ac6a1737a9599a6
Merge: 4f494d009 2e218e4de
Author: Olivier H <olivier.hanesse@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-25 17:30:58 +0200

commit 2e218e4de45026db6f14eed487e78f42b0f04d31
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-25 16:46:49 +0200

    Fixed service_(includes|excludes) tmpl recursion
    
    Fixed a regression introduced in
    9f9bc2040289bd897a9064c6445ebc08221440f9
    
    If an attrubute covered by a property is explicitely set at class or
    instance level (during initialization for example), it breaks
    attribute's template recursion in `get_property_by_inheritance` on
    `if hasattr(self, prop)` (attributes is always seen as affected, even if
    it was never set).
    
    In the present case, it broke service exclusion defined on templates
    rather than host.

    Fix: tests erroneously assumed that arbiterlink's id attribute would always be 0
    
    which can be if the test script is run alone,
    
    but so it can also be different if others tests were executed by the same (nose-)process instance, like with:
    
    nosetests -xv test_action.py  test_arbiterlink_errors.py
    
    find_by_name() is here for that.

commit f0c08e07d074004905bb1a7b1025dea7cfdc75f3
Merge: b71492f0d ddc41bd12
Author: Sébastien Coavoux <Seb-Solon@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2015-03-20 12:42:57 -0400

    Merge pull request #1544 from AccelerationNet/rc-init-scripts-for-individual-daemons
    
    Fix : improve script directory finding in init scripts

commit ddc41bd121f5aeeeba6b1a2e071ee609187cb499
Author: Ryan Davis <ryan@acceleration.net>
Date:   2015-03-20 12:18:03 -0400

    improve script directory finding in init scripts
    
    the per-daemon init scripts delegate to the main `shinken` init
    script. In order to do this, they find the current directory (where all
    the init scripts are defined), and then calls `$curdir/shinken`.
    
    The previous method of finding the current directory did not account for
    symlinks, so running something like `/etc/rc2.d/S20shinken-poller
    start` (where `S20shinken-poller` is a symlink)
    would assume the current directory is `/etc/rc2.d/`, and then fail when
    it couldn't find the main shinken init script.
    
    This patch uses the method from http://stackoverflow.com/a/1638397 to
    find the current directory of the script and resolve symlinks.
    
    refs #1543

2	2	bin/init.d/shinken-arbiter
2	2	bin/init.d/shinken-broker
2	2	bin/init.d/shinken-poller
2	2	bin/init.d/shinken-reactionner
2	2	bin/init.d/shinken-receiver
2	2	bin/init.d/shinken-scheduler

commit 86e10fdf6eb86a555b0a805a636a9c6675309d3f
Merge: 8f41450ef 34336a29e
Author: Gabès Jean <naparuba@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-02-11 20:29:51 +0100

    Merge pull request #1511 from gst/enh_replace_list_copies_with_iter
    
    Enh: scheduler: don't create unnecessarily (many) copies of services and...

commit 34336a29e13dfdfbd1199f7b706715ffa2bc56a9
Author: Grégory Starck <gregory.starck@savoirfairelinux.com>
Date:   2015-02-11 13:38:16 -0500

    Enh: scheduler: don't create unnecessarily (many) copies of services and hosts when you want to iter over them
    
    particularly this kind:
    
    for elt in [y for y in [x for x in self.hosts] + [x for x in self.services]]:
    
    which create a first list copy of hosts,
    also another list copy of services,
    then create a third one being the sum of the 2 previous ( [..] + [..] )
    then create a fourth one [y for y in [..]+[..] ]
    then iterate over the last one.
    
    On big configs (more than thousands of services or hosts) this could actually quite help.

52	57	shinken/scheduler.py

commit a40237e75f83ee9e3ca787c7cf6af830e7fde465
Author: Grégory Starck <gregory.starck@savoirfairelinux.com>
Date:   2015-02-10 15:03:05 -0500

    Fix: fixed unstable assert in test_continuous_notifications_delayed
    
    which so failed from time to time.
    
    This could be relatively easily reproduced by executing the test under high load,
    which can be quickly done with a simple bash for loop :
    
    from within shinken/test:
    
    $ for x in $(seq 20) ; do ( nosetests -xv test_notifications:TestNotif.test_continuous_notifications_delayed &> res_$x || echo "===> $x failed ===" ) & done
    
    and you nearly always got at least one failed test instance.
    
    Now, starting up to 500 such test instances in parallel doesn't trigger anymore the failed assert :p

9	14	test/test_notifications.py

Date:   2015-02-10 10:58:42 -0500

    Enh/Fix: restore Service.display_name previous behavior
    
    That is: if a Service.display_name is not explicitely set/configured,
    then return service_description.
    
    display_name is obviously better to stay a str instance, nothing else.
    
    This had side-effect (on livestatus already) since https://github.com/naparuba/shinken/pull/1480,
    see for instance: https://travis-ci.org/shinken-monitoring/mod-livestatus/jobs/50215670

Author: Grégory Starck <gregory.starck@savoirfairelinux.com>
Date:   2015-01-21 16:58:23 -0500

    Enh: modulesmanager: less requirement on the module to be loaded.
    
    Now shinken "modules" (which should be package, simply for clarity already) aren't anymore required to have the '.module' submodule.
    If they declare(or import) their 'properties' dict and 'get_instance' function in the package __init__ then it'll be ok.
    
    Previous ways are still tried after if this new one doesn't succeed.

commit 0992aafec5181b79d3ee0740f317ea2d0b974793
Author: Grégory Starck <gregory.starck@savoirfairelinux.com>
Date:   2015-02-03 12:02:04 -0500

    Fix: don't error if servicedependency reference a service that is excluded/not included.
    
    If a host specific service is either excluded (service_excludes) or not included (service_includes) in the host services,
    then if this host is part of some servicedependency rule (as dependent or depended on) then that servicedependency must be disabled/dropped.
    
    Otherwise you always get a "Service xxx not found for host yyy".

31	9	shinken/objects/servicedependency.py

    + better docstrings.

commit 7c8d97e85d60c5e5e00e6e057f478375447741bd
Author: Grégory Starck <gregory.starck@savoirfairelinux.com>
Date:   2015-01-30 10:25:59 -0500

    Clean: remove shinken/singleton.py ; not used
    
    More over it was simply broken:
    
    it missed a return cls.instance at the end its __call__ method.
    
    
    Python 2.7.6 (default, Mar 22 2014, 22:59:56)
    [GCC 4.8.2] on linux2
    Type "copyright", "credits" or "license()" for more information.
    >>> class Singleton(type):
        def __init__(cls, name, bases, dict):
            super(Singleton, cls).__init__(name, bases, dict)
            cls.instance = None
        def __call__(cls, *args, **kw):
            if cls.instance is None:
                cls.instance = super(Singleton, cls).__call__(*args, **kw)
                return cls.instance
    
    
    >>> class X(object):
            __metaclass__ = Singleton
    
    
    >>> singleton = X()
    >>> new = X()
    >>> new is singleton
    False
    >>> type(X)
    <class '__main__.Singleton'>
    >>>

0	39	shinken/singleton.py

commit 9a1772a30ca7039d3018835288a1293a17b3720c
Author: Romain LE DISEZ <romain.ledisez@ovh.net>
Date:   2014-12-10 11:46:23 +0100

    Ensure that livestatus client close its connections
    
    The LSConnectionPool does not close the connections after the end of the
    requests. On long running process doing regular livestatus request, it
    quickly saturate the maximum allowed file descriptor. The commit ensures
    that connections are closed after the results have been read.

1	0	shinken/clients/livestatus.py

Date:   2014-11-18 11:10:24 -0500

    add test that triggers the bug.
    
    Fix: daterange.get_month_by_id: bad modulo used.
    
    the given month id is 1 based : 1 == january -> 12 == december.
    but we "% 12" it so the result is 0 -> 11.
    
    but Daterange.months values goes from 1 -> 12 ..  BAM.

commit fbf22c291f2ec02ec14a0e9278686c3c6de95ed4
Author: Grégory Starck <gregory.starck@savoirfairelinux.com>
Date:   2014-10-20 14:23:16 -0400

    Fix/Enh: changed all bare "except" to "except Exception".
    
    bare except are bads/evil.
    
    https://docs.python.org/2/howto/doanddont.html
    
    Used:
    
    find -type f -name '*.py' -exec egrep -q '[^a-zA-Z]except\s*\:' {} \;  -print | while read f ; do sed -i 's#\sexcept\s*\:# except Exception:#' "$f" ; done # could be a shorter one :p

commit 9fc11fa0e17fa9664312110d8b610c4f7e0fc661
Author: David Gil <david.gil.marcos@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-10-15 17:26:14 +0200

    Fixed service totals and host totals
    
    Hi!
    
    The algorithm to get the % of OK services and OK hosts is wrong. There is a problem rounding the result. You will always lose precision with an amount of services greater than 100.
    
    Here's an example:
    
    ```
    >>> all_services = 9000
    >>> problem_services = 20
    >>> 100-problem_services*100/all_services
    100
    >>> # WTF! I have critical services and my status is still 100% OK? Mmmmm
    ...
    >>> int(100-problem_services*100/float(all_services))
    99
    ```
    
    This avoid confusions at the currently dashboard (and maybe in other parts of shinken)

2	2	shinken/misc/datamanager.py

commit 993d1ac3c04cba2fc07e2f31bf155d6432ed8c80
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-10-11 14:16:45 +0200

    Expands bp_rules t flag from tags rather than use
    
    Tags are now recursed, which is not the case for templates in the `use`
    parameter.
    
    This patch expands the `t` flag in business rules expand expressions against
    `tags` rather than direct templates in `use`.

5	5	shinken/dependencynode.py
4	4	shinken/util.py

commit 44d8a9b77a61ca2107dbfca6e1e8e93ef6d5bb3b
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-10-11 13:41:08 +0200

    Use standard macros expansion in bp_rules output.
    
    The limited set of expression expanded in business rules output templates is
    now replaced by a standard and full macro expansion using the `MacroResolver`
    class.
    
    The common `STATUS`, `SHORTSTATUS` and `FULLNAME` macros are also added to
    ease output templates writing on business rules using mixed hosts and
    services.

Merge: 3e8ab43b7 6f3e5a0b4
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-09-05 18:42:32 +0000

    Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master' into config_parse_optimize
    
    Conflicts:
            shinken/daemons/arbiterdaemon.py
            shinken/dispatcher.py
            shinken/objects/config.py
            shinken/objects/hostdependency.py
            shinken/objects/item.py

commit 3e8ab43b712cf32c7243a6d7b60a79baf2411de3
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-06-17 09:46:25 +0000

    Config parse refactoring and optimization
    
    * On the fly old attribute names to new ones (before adding object in
      configuration).
    * Separated standard items from templates to avoid unnecessary iterations, and
      reduce the dependency on is_tpl() method call.
    * Fixed a limitation on services exclusion: when a service having dependencies
      was excluded, there were an error in dependencies handling. This is fixed by
      the explode phase refactoring.
    * On the fly objects indexation during explode phase (no more call to
      create_reversed_list() is necessary) to optimize the explode phase.
    * Added complex expression detection to use standard recursion for simple
      expressions (most of the situations) rather than complex tree parsing to
      optimize the explode phase.
    * On the fly conflict detection and management (no more twins management nor
      call to remove_twins() is necessary).
    * Adding and indexing items are now done through method calls for better
      control and easier update.
    * On the fly service exclusion during explode phase.
    * Hardened config check: declaring a service with no bound host nor hostgroup
      raise an error.
    * Added arbiter and scheduler config dump under JSON notation on SIGUSR2.

Author: andrewmcgilvray <a.mcgilvray@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-06-03 14:20:21 +1000

    Prevent duplicate members in contactgroup
    
    With respect to : https://github.com/naparuba/shinken/issues/993
    
    The livestatus module ( and possibly others ) uses the Regenerator class and merging contactgroup members from multiple schedulers which was resulting in duplicate members.

1	0	shinken/misc/regenerator.py

commit ffcb1963fbc4f7476d67bb23f9f639f68e26fcd5
Author: andrewmcgilvray <a.mcgilvray@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-06-03 14:17:52 +1000

    Do not set master actions to inpoller
    
    Master notifications do not get sent to the reactionners but if they are set to inpoller the schedulers believe they have been. When they hit their timeout they the schedulers think the reactionners have not responded and throw a warning.

2	2	shinken/scheduler.py

commit 157e93fce14148f3689e5e830722c3c55f97209d
Author: Romain LE DISEZ <romain.git@ledisez.net>
Date:   2014-05-01 12:16:04 +0200

    Avoids collisions of Downtime.id between schedulers
    
    Each scheduler starts Downtime.id from 1 and increments it by 1 at each
    downtime creation. So, when running multiple schedulers, multiple
    downtimes will have the same ID. Commands like DEL_SVC_DOWNTIME are
    broadcasted to all schedulers for execution. When deleting a downtime,
    if the ID is not unique, all the downtimes that have the same ID will be
    deleted. By using microseconds since 1970-01-01 as an ID, the probability
    of collision is reduced.

4	3	shinken/downtime.py

commit 97c667a0a7fcfbf5a9dc6617472ebcf0f9a4b0b5

commit 38ce9fb53ad1d144c38bf53449480489ff271dfb
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-02-18 09:33:02 +0100

    Blocked bp_rules smart notifs on host downtime
    
    This patch adds a missing feature in smart notifications: when a
    business rule had services in non ok state, but the host was under
    scheduled downtime, a notification was risen. With it, services wich
    host is under scheduled downtime won't alert anymore.

9	5	shinken/objects/schedulingitem.py

commit 73776206e4ac9aebe9f78d25da9b143c65f846b8
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-11-29 15:25:56 +0100

    Fixes filter related fuctions.
    
    When configuration is incorect (unknown or wrong host/service parameter),
    exceptions may be risen by business rules parsing in filter related
    functions (passed host/service may be None) before error massage may be
    displayed.
    
    This fixes this issue by checking that all required parameters are set.

24	0	shinken/util.py

commit 234961918b12b3f606d8aaad81351373f5ccf2d1
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-11-26 12:56:13 +0100

    Added bp_rule child notification opts management
    
    This patch adds notification options management to business rules. It
    allows to enforce business rule's child hosts/services notification options to
    easily build consolidated checks.

commit 2c1ed1bf12ad261cb95f7c897179e811350e7ea7
Merge: 2c837f3e7 1710bc450
Author: Gabès Jean <naparuba@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-11-24 23:22:21 -0800

    Merge pull request #1036 from geektophe/fix_single_service_override_coma_split
    
    FIX: Fixed a bug on single service override attribute.

commit 1710bc4509f1188aa12d3ef1c0f882094abdf463
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-11-22 21:10:18 +0100

    Fixed a bug on single service override attribute.
    
    When a single service_override_attribute was set on a host, it is
    splitted on comma used as host/service delimiter, and attribute value
    get false.
    
    This patch adds an additionnal property attribute named `split_on_coma`
    that indicates if a single value should be splitted on coma delimiter.
    
    The `service_overrides` attribute is explicitely declared as non splitted.

commit c0e87edbf8b97f9a0a3494b4e8088d76674691e5
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-11-04 16:37:19 +0100

    Added the ability to hide service in problems view
    
    If both an host/service instance has the `hide_in_ui_problems` flag set and a
    user has the `hide_ui_problems` flag set, the host/service is hidden to the
    user in the webui problems view, even if he's set as contact to this
    host/service.
    
    This allows to hide services in the ui but continue to receive
    notifications.

commit 7c745a591cff5ef3d70ce98e3ab24a08ca8d9091
Merge: f2b409e1e 4abc31dca
Author: Gabès Jean <naparuba@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-10-24 07:15:16 -0700

    [duplicate_foreach with event_handler]

commit 4abc31dcae00afff2f2b41da8d48d106493d438d
Author: Jean-Charles <jean-charles.delon@matricscom.eu>
Date:   2013-10-24 15:15:31 +0200

    duplicate_foreach with event_handler
    
    Hi,
    
    I need the ability to use the "duplicate_foreach" property with the item event_handler.
    
    see below for an example:
    
    define service{
       service_description  PRC_$KEY$
       use                  linux-nrpe-service
       register             0
       host_name            linux-nrpe
       check_command        check_nrpe_args!check_procs!$_HOSTPROC_WARN$!$_HOSTPROC_CRIT$!$KEY$
       event_handler       launch_nrpe_args!launch_procs!$KEY$!restart!
       duplicate_foreach    _prc
    }
    
    By default the $KEY$ for event_handler is not instanciated.
    
    If we look further in the shinken code, there's a place where this can be done easily (objects/services.py).
    
    # Here is a list of property where we will expand the $KEY$ by the value
    _the_expandables = ['check_command', 'aggregation', 'service_dependencies']
    
    just add 'event_handler' to the list to do the job.

1	1	shinken/objects/service.py

commit 59949e0595e89ca4154367f64364f878a989b045
Merge: a450d3dc8 4a27aedfe
Author: Gabès Jean <naparuba@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-09-09 00:35:00 -0700

    Merge pull request #992 from geektophe/pb_rules_negative_xof
    
    Added reversed (negative) Xof business rules.

commit 4a27aedfeb77308335eb6b1e4c058877bdef53ee
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-09-06 21:29:05 +0200

    Added reversed (negative) xof business rules.
    
    Standard Xof: business rules are used to express idioms such as "at
    least X services OK", or "at least X hosts UP". Negative business rules allow
    to use the reversed form to express idioms such as "at most X services
    WARNING or CRITICAL" or "at most X hosts DOWN".
    
    Also factorised Xof elements processing using an inner function.
    
    Finall, fixed test_properties_defaults.py (forgot to update it in
    previous pull request).

18	17	shinken/dependencynode.py
28	0	test/etc/business_correlator/services.cfg
66	18	test/test_business_correlator.py
6	4	test/test_properties_defaults.py

commit 05ed755e32118484e80d65cb3a71c2762b91147d
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-09-02 22:14:28 +0200

    Fix on impacts/problems retention loaded services
    
    When services in non ok state were loaded from retention,
    impacts/problems hierarchy was not loaded no rebuild, which breaked the
    notification processing.
    
    This patch fixes this issue by forcing problems/impacts registration even when
    no state change is detected.

commit 507df82e7ac77042aa2a956b7db93df92527a3ff
Author: Christophe Simon <geektophe@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-08-29 12:12:25 +0200

    Fixed Config's `resource_macros_names` definition.
    
    The `resource_macros_names` in the `Config` class was declared as
    `StringProp`, but this attribute is a list object. This mislead the
    multi valued attribute processing that returned the last list element
    rather than the list itself.
    
    Also removed the last uncecessary [] on the `_echo` command definition.

commit df928335d5ce2820f6c79c4f6846c44e754d40c6
Author: Christophe SIMON <christophe.simon@dailymotion.com>
Date:   2013-08-22 12:09:05 +0200

    Added service instance properties override feature
    
    It allows to override specific service instances properties through the
    definition of the new `serviceoverride` object. This is mainly useful for
    dynamycally generated services such as those linked to host templates (those
    defined in packs for instances), or linked to hostgroups. This allows to
    override a specific instance parameters without having to define a complete
    new service.

    Minor enhancement on business output processing.
    
    This adds more details on business rules having an Xof: syntax. With the
    previous patch alone, if an Xof: business rule had an OK state, but one
    of its childs had a non OK state, the information was not displayed.
    This patch adds this information in the output.

Author: Christophe SIMON <christophe.simon@dailymotion.com>
Date:   2013-08-14 15:15:27 +0200

    Added macro expansion to business rules.
    
    To support macro modulation, business rules are re-evaluated on each
    service scheduling loop, and checked for error to detect erroneous macro
    substitution.
    
    Also added the ability to force a service scheduling without setting its
    status or return value in ShinkenTest class. Used to force business rules
    processing in tests.

    Fixed some issues with serializing unhandled datatypes for Json and msgpack. Default to using str() for msgpack, print sets as lists for JSON.

10	4	shinken/modules/zmq_broker.py

commit e9678b61f71de8fcd9df1d3561a81aeec643d00a
Author: thomascellerier <thomascellerier@gmail.com>

6	2	shinken/modules/zmq_broker.py

commit 8fb72c8cf7dc83dd22e7ff34bd0134b06268f728
Author: thomascellerier <thomascellerier@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-02-12 02:41:00 -0800

    A ZeroMQ pub socket broker for shinken
    
    This broker allows you to publish update data to a ZeroMQ pub socket (tcp, ipc or inproc). Anybody can then subscribe to that endpoint to receive status updates.
    
    The serialization method is configurable. Supported formats so far are json and msgpack.

115	0	shinken/modules/zmq_broker.py

    dashboard/currently: use a 24H clock format

    commit makes it 24H based.

commit 3f1f859ffddaad03db76265891d269e23745c38c
Author: xkilian <fmikus@acktomic.com>
Date:   2012-10-07 01:38:54 -0300

    Fix: Make scheduler more deterministic
    
    1 - Avoid scheduling at the end of a minute for recurring checks that are multiples of 60.
    2 - Use random.uniform instead of random.random to evenly distribute checks.
    3 - Use a larger time-window to schedule checks, more efficient formula.
    
    Overall the patch should make Shinken friendly to metric databases that like to receive
    data in a recurring period.

26	10	shinken/objects/schedulingitem.py

commit c908edadadb866292a612103d2854bef4673efab
Author: Hartmut Goebel <h.goebel@crazy-compilers.com>
Date:   2012-07-29 22:54:57 +0200

    Remove superfluous import of shinken.objects in shinken/_init__.py.
    
    Every script or test-case importing shinken has all the objects loaded,
    even if they are not required by the script or test-case at all.
    
    Also see <http://sourceforge.net/mailarchive/message.php?msg_id=29553474>.

commit 718ef55c7843a71d672206ef002ef3f025b6b2fa
Author: Hartmut Goebel <h.goebel@crazy-compilers.com>

commit 7a3e53ec0537e7e63bfbc8caf1a30a350c2e9eea
Author: Hartmut Goebel <h.goebel@crazy-compilers.com>
Date:   2012-07-15 19:26:15 +0200

    Allow turning of the human timestamp format after it's been turned on.
    
    The interface of logging.Log did only allow to switch to the human timstamp
    format, but not switching back. This will be rarely used in applications
    but is needed for test-cases.

8	3	shinken/log.py

commit 049f83005db95f0c90088b88e1edaa111a930405
Author: Hartmut Goebel <h.goebel@crazy-compilers.com>
Date:   2012-07-15 18:56:07 +0200

    Fix: logging level must be set when instantiating the Log object.
    
    A Log object need a logging level attribute even if load_obj() is not
    called (and thus no broker for collecting the log messages is attached).

3	1	shinken/log.py

commit 5131b14e72cbfc15828e939f2d0c4ed3918d6490
Author: Hartmut Goebel <h.goebel@crazy-compilers.com>
Date:   2012-07-14 13:14:42 +0200

    Clean-up: Use time.asctime() w/o parameters if `now` is meant.
    
    time.asctime defaults to `now` if no parameter is given. So there is no
    need to pass somwthing like time.localtime(time.time()).

1	2	shinken/log.py
2	2	test/test_maintenance_period.py

commit b06ce7ed0c82be2ccab57b3714f8cc0db7436bbd
Author: Hartmut Goebel <h.goebel@crazy-compilers.com>
Date:   2012-07-14 13:03:40 +0200

    Remove pseudo-compatibility function shinken.utils.if_else().
    
    This function was introduced in
    2012-05-01T21:44:00Z!gerhard.lausser@consol.de as "a ternary operator
    workaround ensures compatibility with python 2.4".
    
    Using a function has a major drawback: all values passed as arguments have
    to be evaluated prior to the call. In opposite to the ternity operator and
    the well-known `... and ... or` pattern, where only the resulting part gets
    evaluated.
    
    It is used only in shinken.log and one of the values passed is
    `time.asctime(time.localtime(time.time()))` which is quite heavy for being
    evaluated without using it.
    
    So I remove this function at all and replace it by either boring if-else-
    statements or the `... and ... or` pattern.

9	4	shinken/log.py
0	7	shinken/util.py

commit 3016e910f4d2bf7ca431d10fd94fb953da883bf4
Author: Hartmut Goebel <h.goebel@crazy-compilers.com>
Date:   2012-07-29 20:57:41 +0200

    Add helper module for importing the shinken library from parent dir.
    
    I put this into a separate module as it may be useful for test-cases not
    importing `shinken_test` for any reason.

46	0	test/__import_shinken.py
2	4	test/shinken_test.py

commit b6204349b4c0f1268764a189742723f9d633330b
Merge: c52aeabfc 14704a835
Author: Hartmut Goebel <h.goebel@crazy-compilers.com>
Date:   2012-07-16 23:48:27 +0200

    Unify redundant object-config files in test-cases.
    
    This reduces approx. 550 files to 9 (nine) standard configs.

commit 14704a8350530ad7023d21c35237370285247666
Author: Hartmut Goebel <h.goebel@crazy-compilers.com>
Date:   2012-07-16 22:45:32 +0200

    Use standard plus a special object-config and remove identical files.
    
    The `hostgroups.cfg` used here is the standard one plus a hostgroup
    `allhosts`. This hostgroup is put into a new file `hostgroups-allhosts.cfg`
    be it's own. The config-file is changed to include both.
    
    * Change the `cfg_file=` entry to point to `standard/hostgroups.cfg`.
    * Add a `cfg_file=standard/hostgroups-allhosts.cfg` entry.
    * Remove the now unused object-config-files.
    
    This removes another 5 redundant files.

0	55	test/etc/5r_100h_2000s/hostgroups.cfg
0	56	test/etc/business_rules_bad_realm_conf/hostgroups.cfg
0	55	test/etc/dependencies/hostgroups.cfg
3	1	test/etc/nagios_10r_1000h_20000s.cfg
3	1	test/etc/nagios_5r_100h_2000s.cfg
3	1	test/etc/nagios_business_rules_bad_realm_conf.cfg

0	55	test/etc/problem_impact/hostgroups.cfg
7	0	test/etc/{10r_1000h_20000s/hostgroups.cfg => standard/hostgroups-no-allhosts.cfg}

    config file describing the difference and it's reason.

commit 58b83d6af54bb63f02ad80d06b470cd80faeb904
Author: Hartmut Goebel <h.goebel@crazy-compilers.com>
Date:   2012-07-15 15:15:49 +0200

    Avoid building (nearly) the same list multiple times just for counting.
    
    Building a list just counting elements of another list matching a certain
    condition is overhead. Doing this multiple times with the same input-
    list starts becoming ugly code.
    
    Replace this by iterating over the input-list once and simply count.

commit f0b55d76901f230e0e550cf3097d22c252965a67
Author: Hartmut Goebel <h.goebel@crazy-compilers.com>
Date:   2012-07-15 14:37:03 +0200

    Remove possible dangerous use of `sudo` for removing user-files.
    
    The files within the development directory ought to be used by the user,
    so there is no need for using `sudo` for their removal. Esp. since
    an intruder could use this for removing system files by putting some
    sym-links owned by the user.

commit 630db60812314f754c09e3dc820834f99309b193
Author: Hartmut Goebel <h.goebel@crazy-compilers.com>
Date:   2012-07-13 15:36:28 +0200

    Clean-up: Wrap long lines, use string template and argparse destinations.
    
    The only long lines have been used for building the subject and the
    body of the mail. These have been replaces by string-templates, which
    get fed the parsed commands line args.
    
    To keep the string-templates short, some command line args are now parsed
    into names different from the argument-name.
    
    Now unused variables have been removed.
    Some command line args get parsed into destinations matching the
    pre-existing variable-names.

18	12	libexec/sendmailservice.py

      have some semantics.

      code.

Date:   2012-07-07 14:47:33 +0200

    Clean-up strings (issue #99): Remove spaces in front of colons, `!` and `?`.

      custom lib2to3 fixer. This ensures, only strings are changed.

      syntax (e.g. SQL, Nagios result protocol) are changed. I apologize
      for the case I changed one which should not have been changes.
    * In accordance with English typing rules.
    * Special cases (e.g. table-like text, code snippets) have been left
      unchanged.

commit be443026815097e353fb7625809d0e9fd8569fdf
Author: Naparuba <naparuba@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-04-18 16:46:12 +0200

    Fix : UI with widgets there is a possibility that the jit.js lib is not loaded before the graph is asking for it. So in the init function, we ask for the jit existance, and if not, postpone the init for 1s.

Date:   2012-02-29 15:10:51 +0100

    ndodb_mysql_broker module was not working on python2.5
    
    The construct except Exception as inst: has been introduced in
    python2.6. This was leading to package installation on debian fail,
    due to dh_python2 byte-compiling modules on both python2.5 and
    python2.6.

Author: Sebastien Coavoux <s.coavoux@free.fr>
Date:   2012-01-20 18:18:23 +0100

    Code Review.
    Fixed : typo in comments
    Added : licence in files
    Added : personnal tags on comments
            + <WTF??> : Refers to something that is unclear for me so that I can't fix it
            + <TMI!!> : Too Much Information/Comments.
                        This is my opinion, if everyone agrees we remove some.
    Personal Note :
    * I choose to use  """ for class comment and # for other function comments.
    * TODO stuff is good, but please dont use the doc syntax (""") for drafts :)
    * Comments are usally before the function definition not under.
    
    Feel free to (dis)agree

17	11	shinken/acknowledge.py
27	22	shinken/action.py
20	15	shinken/arbiterlink.py
5	4	shinken/autoslots.py

commit 995980f4ebb80a7fe2c6467c192cf35e3e3e4ae1
Author: root <root@localhost.localdomain>
Date:   2011-10-15 13:25:11 +0200

    Added support for Centreon Enterprise Server switch from nagios to shinken ;-).
    If you want to test it :
    - install Centreon Enterprise Server
    - wget or clone the latest shinken version (master branch) from github
    - go to shinken/contrib/alternative-installation/shinken-install
    - execute : ./shinken.sh -i && ./shinken.sh -z.
    - Push configuration from Centreon and that's all !

commit 4f34b5b184518d5b3c74ab26bfe3f9d220116d81
Author: Grégory Starck <g.starck@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-05-23 09:00:06 +0200

    fix/enh: 'shinken' init script:
    
    - Now correctly handles pid file variables defined in possible "shinken_default" file (represented by SHINKEN_DEFAULT_FILE env variable).
    
    If "${MOD}PID" variable doesn't exist (or is empty) then fallback on default pid file values: "$VAR/${mod}d.pid".
    
    - Same for debug file:
    
    if "${MOD}DEBUGFILE" is empty then use "${mod}-debug.log" as default.
    
    - Same for SHINKENCFG & SHINKENSPECIFICCFG files.

commit 900bea1ca14e2cb154f3c52951ace968d1b1b307
Author: Grégory Starck <g.starck@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-05-07 15:07:17 +0200

    Fix: parsing of complex hostgroup_name possible attribute of service definition.
    
    Now expressions as complex as :
    
    A ^ B, ( C ! (D | E & F), ! (D - E)
    
    are successfully parsed.
    
    Nb: previous special case "A & ! B)" (or "A & (! B)") not anymore allowed,
     instead you have to use: "A ! B)". Also equivalent to "A, ! B".
     (== all members that are in group A minus theses that are in group B).

1	1	shinken/daemon.py

commit 55bb897f43ef12647777717a0ba956e57e4d49ee
Author: Grégory Starck <g.starck@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-04-24 15:21:43 +0200

    clean/enh/fix: use relative paths + use by default current user/group for executing all daemons:
    
    Now:
    
    - default user for daemons is now the current one.
        This permits to launch all the daemons directly from a dev directory without any special user privilege.
    
    - test/test_end_to_end.sh can be run from any dev directory.
        It still requires some sudo commands for the test "real install".
    Could be done: separate the "real install" test from test_end_to_end.
    
    - changed default workdir for arbiter to directory designated by "pidfile".
    
    
    - setup.py : correctly set user/group in daemons config files on installation.
    
    
    - some/most of the host/port/user/group/workdir/pidfile config directives of
          the dev&test configs files are now using default values from code.
    
    - tests adapted.
    
    
    TODO:
    - some more cleaning is needed in "daemons" .ini files (brokerd.ini) in dev & tests configs.

commit 2aef5b545768f10a9da9fe039b51263845e645b4
Author: Grégory Starck <g.starck@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-01-18 12:58:20 +0100

    *fix+clean: reworked init scripts: shinken-* are now all using 'shinken' one.
    
    Note to packagers :
    
    So the 'shinken' init script is/must be common to all schinken modules.
    
    So if you'd ever want to split all modules in different packages:
     then there so should be a "shinken-common" package.

commit ddf137fb156418296f92406440722311114855df
Author: Grégory Starck <g.starck@gmail.com>
Date:   2010-12-30 14:34:49 +0100

    converted TAB to 4SP everywhere possible.
    
    I've seen there are quite some files with mixed TAB/4SP indentation.. as all of us should know it could be bad to have that kind of mix with python..
    The very recommended usage in "shared" python code/projects is to use 4SP as indentation block.
    
    Used: http://svn.python.org/projects/python/trunk/Tools/scripts/reindent.py

0	2	bin/launch_all.sh
0	2	bin/launch_all_debug.sh

0	2	shinken/servicedependency.py

commit 3bd23353cac9b19e199f3bc24dbd4bf57b55fd6e
Author: Gabes Jean <naparuba@users.sourceforge.net>
Date:   2010-09-10 14:17:20 +0200

    *Fix : host/service/dependencies where not "fill by default values".
    *Add : new service property to define some simple dependencies (as notification), service_dependencies
    
    Example :
     #Now test dependencies defined in the service def
    define service{
      check_command                  check_service!ok
      check_interval                 1
      host_name                      test_host_1
      retry_interval                 1
      service_description            test_parent_svc
      servicegroups                  servicegroup_02,ok
      use                            generic-service
    }
    
    define service{
      check_command                  check_service!ok
      check_interval                 1
      host_name                      test_host_1
      retry_interval                 1
      service_description            test_son_svc
      servicegroups                  servicegroup_02,ok
      use                            generic-service
      service_dependencies           test_host_1,test_parent_svc
    }
    
    Here test_host_1,test_son_svc will be dependent (no notification raised) if we've got a problem on test_host_1,test_parent_svc
    
    Like for hosts parents, but for services in fact :)

6	1	shinken/config.py
29	7	shinken/service.py
15	0	shinken/servicedependency.py
24	0	test/etc/dependencies/services.cfg
15	0	test/test_dependencies.py

commit 38304a887313b7c42ef94eda712808f518636d67
Author: Gabes Jean <naparuba@users.sourceforge.net>
Date:   2010-07-29 11:14:43 +0200

    *Big change : new layout:
    **bin/ all daemons
    **shinken/ the library call by daemons (or other tools)
    **libexec/ checks
    **etc/ all conf
    **var/ all variables files (logs, temp file, etc)
    **external_commands/ : some exampels of external commands
    **db/ the db sources files for ndo and merlin

commit 07fb0d93c12f45b9fbf5be8d362cfc42d9bb23cd
Author: Gabes Jean <naparuba@users.sourceforge.net>
Date:   2010-06-10 13:41:18 +0200

    *Change the way broks are send from Arbiter to Broker : before, the Broker connect to
    the Arbiter, take broks like for schedulers. But Arbiter also connect to broker. That's
    a nightmare about hangout. Now, Arbiter push the broks. It's far more easy and efficient.

    hosts/services/contacts and we do not link with real ones. So 1000 services -> 2000 timeperiods, etc etc

commit afeed9f8c595304f1e852242ab71206a1fb4cefe
Author: nap <naparuba@users.sourceforge.net>
Date:   2010-02-09 11:29:51 +0100

    *Add the Arbiter spare managment : an arbiter is master, the other is a spare. The master ping the
    spare every loop. If the spare do not listen about the master for some time (hard coded for the moment)
    he take the control and run. If the master returns, he ask the spare to get out, HE is the master.
    *Conf is send from Master to spare with a magic_hash (random int). If the spare have a conf but not hte good one
    (old conf from a previous master send) he drop it and get the new one. The master always refuse conf.
    HE IS THE MASTER!
    *TODO: the spare maybe run without ever eard about the master (take the already load conf) after a long time? Maybe
    a run parameter?

commit bfcc58c722e8f015d1f2949786b221dd009d9f22
Author: nap <naparuba@users.sourceforge.net>
Date:   2010-01-26 16:06:23 +0100

    *Add a way to have multiple -c in shinken-arbiter : so someone who do not have an access to it's
    nagios.cfg (like with Centreon or OP5) can't add it's own cfg_file and so cannot use advanced
    capabilities of Shinken like multiple scheduler. But they have an access to /etc/init.d/nagios, so they
    can change the call to nagios and add another -c in it :)
    *Bug fixe : watch Exception when file of -c was missing.

commit ae391846cdba324b6dfb533d367e354f6014db48
Author: nap <naparuba@users.sourceforge.net>
Date:   2010-01-21 21:34:55 +0100

    A big thanks to Gerhard that fix bugs in the quite complex consume_result function :)
    
    Quite a big commit here, I cannot mix really automatically, so I mix at the hand.
    *Manage escalations : when we search for contacts, we just see if one
    of our escalations is good. If so, take all contacts of al good escalations.
    If not, take self.contacts.
    *Change the way notification are resend after the first return from reactionner :
    the first notification to came back raise all new notifications of the level + 1
    (with escalations etc) like a new notifications, but at t = now + self.notification_interval.
    So all others notifications that came back with the same level (not the new one) do nothing.
    With this, we just launch one notifications packs by notification_number.
    *Some minor bug fixes and error catch in __init__ of modules.
    *OK on OK on consume can be with attemp != 1 if we were in SOFT
    Ex with 5 max_attemps: OK/HARD, CRITICAL/SOFT, OK/SOFT, OK/SOFT, CRITICAL/HARD
    If we put attempt = 1 at the 2nd OK/SOFT, we're got problem after.
    *Bug fixes in calls in get_event_handlers : res =  moved to res.extend

12	1	src/escalation.py

    *Change in the modules capabilities : now they can be in their own directory, in addition to the old simple file.
    It's cleaner to do this : the import thing is done with the __init__.py file, that try to import the code of the other .py (an send None if
    import failed like with bad dependancies). So bigger modules can be written : it can be more than one file in a
    module directory, so now we can make trully clean module code :)
    *So I move current module to this new way.
    *The modulemanager now catch error of bad import of such directories (Warning).

commit 4990db86d952f42d89331e2572e62e384f223181
Author: nap <naparuba@users.sourceforge.net>
Date:   2009-12-15 14:31:42 +0100

    *Add a hot_period in host/service (implicit inheritance) : if set, in this period, the
    critical_is_warning property is not apply. It can be use for low production system : You've got
    a financial server used only in the last week of the month. You do not want critical alert in all others
    weeks. Now you can set critical_is_warning in the host, so all services that do not set it will inherit
     it, and you set hot_period in the last week : now services for this host in the last week will be Critical (if return ==2). In all others weeks, it will be just Warning.

3	2	src/etc/conf.cfg
6	2	src/host.py
2	0	src/scheduler.py
14	3	src/service.py

commit f80f8f4961ef34534ce3ca268c847f6fd3beb84c
Author: nap <naparuba@users.sourceforge.net>
Date:   2009-12-09 11:59:44 +0100

    *Add a polling_interval to pollers/reactionners and brokers so they do not use a 1s poll. With it,
    admin can set priority to pollers : a quicks poll poller will take more checks than a slow one (5s for example).
    *Add a weight property to schedulers : now we use a weight round robin dispatching. Hight weight -> more hosts. For example,
    with a 1500host conf, you can set sched1 with weight=2 and sched2 with weight=1, Sched1 will take 1000hosts,
    sched2 500 (if the dependancies allow it).

commit 6dd6386260376da47101d3f5db37d4bcdee38d5a
Author: nap <naparuba@users.sourceforge.net>
Date:   2009-10-21 15:20:47 +0200

    There was a bug in timeperiod (None value for daterange None but good values for others datareanges...). Complete the spare managment : now zombies elements with conf but dispatcher think it must not have one are find and kill (just wait a new conf). Like if a master die, a spare take teh conf and the master was just network down but still running. It come back, but the dispatcher give the conf to spare, so now master will wait a new conf, that all. So no fail back. Maybe we can think about a fail back feature.
